section: 13. Each Member will be responsible for its respective duties as follows: Page 3 of 13 Member Duties Description BorrowMoney.com, inc *HTML code, build, deploy and maintain all technical aspect requirements including a database for medical dispatch personal & product service as needed, including activity information, data storage and backup. provided by three qualified assigned Borrowmoney.com, inc. employees/personal JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go $60,000.00 USD To be paid within 90 days of signing this agreement. Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue From Awarded Contract, In Addition to The Total Contributions.
explanation: The description of BorrowMoney.com, Inc.'s duties uses vague language. 'HTML code' and 'technical aspect requirements' are not defined, and 'as needed' lacks specificity, making the obligation unclear. This ambiguity creates uncertainty about the scope of their responsibilities. Also, there is no mention on the time frame to have the HTML code, build, deploy and maintain all technical aspect requirements. This makes it difficult to prove if BorrowMoney.com has actually held up their end of the deal.

section: 13. Each Member will be responsible for its respective duties as follows: Page 3 of 13 Member Duties Description BorrowMoney.com, inc *HTML code, build, deploy and maintain all technical aspect requirements including a database for medical dispatch personal & product service as needed, including activity information, data storage and backup. provided by three qualified assigned Borrowmoney.com, inc. employees/personal JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go $60,000.00 USD To be paid within 90 days of signing this agreement. Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue From Awarded Contract, In Addition to The Total Contributions.
explanation: JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go is required to pay '$60,000.00 USD To be paid within 90 days of signing this agreement. Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue From Awarded Contract, In Addition to The Total Contributions'. It does not specify the period that this would be given. It does not specify for how long it would be given, and is open ended.

section: 15. Each of the Members has contributed to the capital of the Venture, in cash or property in agreed upon value, as follows (the "Capital Contribution"): Member Contribution Description Agreed Value BorrowMoney.com, inc 1, 500 square feet of Leased/rent office Space Includingspecified Description of duty* $3,500,000.00 USD JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go $60,000.00 USD in cash. Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue, In Add i t i on to The To ta l Contributions. $3,500,000.00 USD
explanation: The value assigned to BorrowMoney.com, Inc.'s contribution of '1,500 square feet of Leased/rent office Space Includingspecified Description of duty*' is $3,500,000.00 USD. This amount seems extraordinarily high for office space, raising concerns about whether the valuation is accurate or inflated. The phrase 'Includingspecified Description of duty*' is also unclear and seems to be missing information. Furthermore, the value given to  JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go has a value of $3,500,000.00 USD, which is not logical. They both have the same value but contributed different items.

section: 15. Each of the Members has contributed to the capital of the Venture, in cash or property in agreed upon value, as follows (the "Capital Contribution"): Member Contribution Description Agreed Value BorrowMoney.com, inc 1, 500 square feet of Leased/rent office Space Includingspecified Description of duty* $3,500,000.00 USD JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go $60,000.00 USD in cash. Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue, In Add i t i on to The To ta l Contributions. $3,500,000.00 USD
explanation: There is misaligned terminology within the contract. The term 'Capital Contribution' is defined in section 59(a). In this case, it is not defined or properly explained what the Capital Contributions are.

section: 39. In the absence of a written agreement setting a value, the value of the Venture will be determined based on the total revenue generated over the last 3 months. An appraiser will be appointed within a reasonable period of the date of withdrawal or dissolution. The results of the appraisal will be binding on all Members. A withdrawing Member's interest will be based on the proportion of their respective capital account less any outstanding liabilities a Member may have to the Venture. The intent of this section is to ensure the survival of the Venture despite the withdrawal of any individual Member.
explanation: The valuation method based solely on the last 3 months of revenue may not accurately reflect the Venture's true value, especially for ventures with fluctuating revenue streams or long-term growth potential. This could unfairly disadvantage a withdrawing member if the 3-month period is uncharacteristically low. The statement makes it seem like this is the only method to use. This is an ambigious legal term and could lead to multiple interpretations.

section: 39. In the absence of a written agreement setting a value, the value of the Venture will be determined based on the total revenue generated over the last 3 months. An appraiser will be appointed within a reasonable period of the date of withdrawal or dissolution. The results of the appraisal will be binding on all Members. A withdrawing Member's interest will be based on the proportion of their respective capital account less any outstanding liabilities a Member may have to the Venture. The intent of this section is to ensure the survival of the Venture despite the withdrawal of any individual Member.
explanation: The phrase 'a reasonable period' for appointing an appraiser is vague and undefined. This lack of clarity can lead to disputes over how quickly the appraisal must be initiated, especially in situations where a prompt valuation is critical. This is an ambigious text and could lead to multiple interpretations.
